story:
Bitte ganz nach unten scrollen für die deutsche Version.  (Scroll down for the german version)

Testimony from the lead developer:

Hello,  my name is Jens and I am the lead developer of this project. I got  diagnosed with diabetes (mellitus) type 1 in 1994 at the age of 14.  Since then I experienced many improvements through the innovation of new  medicaments and new technical tools supporting the diabetes therapy. The  latest steps for me were ground-breaking: in January 2018 I switched to  an pump and a CGM sensor which is monitoring my blood sugar  level every 5 minutes. In February 2018 I set up a closed loop  regulating system ("the loop") using my android mobile phone. This had a  huge impact as now my blood sugar levels were now very close to a non  diabetic's levels without any severe hypoglycaemia (too few sugar in the  blood) and with a reduced level of non-severe hypoglycaemias. Also this  came with much more comfort and safety. I may even read my blood  sugar levels on my arm watch.

Even though the loop brings you quite  well and safe through the night, sometimes you wake up and wonder what  your blood sugar levels might be. This was a small gap of comfort  during the night because I would not wear my arm watch and I had too  look for my phone on the night desk and then try to read the sugar level  with sleepy eyes. I decided I want to close the gap and create a device  that is showing the time, blood sugar level and development direction  on the display in huge, easy readable letters.

If you have diabetes and have no idea what I was talking about above, I suggest you find out more regarding these topics:

- pumps (is this right for me?)

- any continuous blood glucose measurement systems like CGM systems or FGM systems (with some tweaks)

- the Nightscout project - bringing your data to the cloud allowing cross device access and web based reporting

The  blood glucose clock introduced with this project is dependent on the  usage of the Nightscout project for storing your continuous blood glucose  levels coming from a CMG or FGM system. It is obtaining these values  through the usage of a mandatory WiFi internet connection (a stationary  WiFi router is recommended). 

Disclaimers:

 Please  do not make any therapeutical decisions based on the device's display.  If you do so you do it on your own risk. This is not a medical device  and not compliant with any medical standards or regulations.

Technical disclaimer: 

You need to use Nightscout with this project. You need a WiFi  internet connection and a mobile phone with Android (iOS (Apple) through  4.000€ stretch goal)  to configure the device. You need any setup that  uploads your CGM/FCM blood glucose levels to Nightscout.

What you will get:

We designed the clock without any buttons. So the configuration will  be done through an android (iOS (Apple) through 4.000€ stretch goal)  "control app" that is supplied free of charge. Due to Apple's  arbitrariness regarding the acceptance of apps created on their  platforms, we cannot guarantee the release of the iOS (Apple) version  even though it is quite probable.

Product Features:

- Android Bluetooth control app (Apple stretch goal)

- 12h/24h clock configurable

- time zone configurable

- time is taken from an internet source

- colour changeable through app

- brightness configurable through app

- automatic brightness levelling is optional and configurable through the app

The blood sugar clock will be updatable via internet. This will also apply to the prototypes.

We will deliver the clocks in the order of the indigogo backing  number (prototype pledge levels have an earlier delivery date). The assembly is a manual process.

The shipping will be charged separately through the pledge manager process.

We will offer free colour options (at least one) and optionally addon  colouring during the pledge manager process. We have not decided, yet  what the options will be. We have also not decided, yet, on the casing's  material. This will also be dependent on the number of devices we sell.  Under 100 devices we prefer to use our 3D printer to produce the  casings. We will consider buying a second one with 50 devices sold. With  100 devices sold we will consider outsourcing the case production to a  moulding lab. This would impact the project's timetable negatively but  improve the casings quality drastically.

Note: Most likely the casing will be 3D printer produced and will not  have the feel and quality you are accustomed to with industrial  manufactured plastics. If we choose the use PLA as the 3D printer  plastic the casing should not be subjected to temperatures above 70°C  and not to direct sunlight. Therefore PLA would be a bad material to  have in your car. We are still working on optimizing the production and  pre-production process.

The device is powered by a 5V micro USB port. The power plug and  cables are not supplied with the device. We might add these as a small  add-on through the pledge manager. A usual USB (1 A is sufficient) power  plug and micro USB cable (most phones use these!) are already found in  most households.

State of the project 

 

We have finalized the hardware that we want to employ. This  includes a microprocessor board with Bluetooth and WiFi and low energy  consumption. We chose a 2.8" colour TFT display for a modern display and a  photo sensitive LED (photo sensor) to allow a sourrounding matching  brightness configuration. We are currently storing the configuration in  the code and are able to read & display blood glucose levels and  development directions from an SSL encrypted nightscout page. We have  almost finished the casing design. Mainly we need optimize the fitting  of the microprocessor board and the access to the USB power plug. We  also need to figure out which screws may be suitable. We have set up a  sample Bluetooth connection and we have prepared code for the firmware  update process.

The Team

We have a small office in the Hanover region. Our project team consists of

 Jens: lead senior software developer with a diploma in computer science.

 Anna Lena: junior software developer (does most of the work ;-) )

 Sonja: Marketing 

 Hannes: CAD case design

The Company

 The company "ibis-IT" is operating since 2011 engaging in very different software and small hardware projects. We are currently in transition changing the legal form of the company. The project is operated by the newly founded "ibis-IT UG (haftungsbeschränkt)". Most likely by the time of delivery the suffix UG will replaced with GmbH which is a legal form of the same time with higher authorized capital. Jens is the CEO of the company.

Side note: The whole setup of Jens' open loop system

- Sooil Dana-R pump (newest Version is Dana-RS!)

- Dexcom G5 CGM System (switching to G6 in 2019)

- Android mobile phone OnePlus 5T using X-Drip for reading CGM values  and AndroidAPS for the closed loop and pump control.

- Sony Smart Watch 2 as an additional blood sugar display

- Blood sugar clock on the night table ;-)

Thank you for your support and thank you to the open source  community especially the individuals involved providing us with such  such great tools as Nightscout, OpenAPS, AndroidAPS and xDrip!!!

revealed Stretch Goals:

4.000 €: iOS Control App

5.000 €: add second 3D-Printer to the production line

6.000 €: support minor switchable themes or backgrounds

Shipping Costs, Taxes & Customs:

All shipping costs will be added post-campaign. This is necessary to cover all individual locations. The package should be < 2kg. So Germany should be around 6 €, EU around 15 €, USA around 20 €  - to give you a rough estimate.

The product is delivered from Europe. For Europeans there are no customs and the taxes are included. For outside EU we will cover the VAT (until max. 25%). If it not covered with our customs declaration you will receive the VAT as a refund when you provide a proof.

Trademarks:

Dana-R, Dexcom G5/G6, OnePlus 5T, Sony Smart Watch, X-Drip and AndroidAPS and Nightscout are trademarks of their respective owners.

German Translation

Deutsche Übersetzung

Statement des leitenden Entwicklers:

Hallo, mein Name ist Jens und bin der leitende Entwickler dieses Projekts. Ich wurde 1994 im Alter von 14 Jahren mit Diabetes (Mellitus) Typ 1 diagnostiziert. Seitdem habe ich viele Verbesserungen durch die Innovation von neuen Medikamenten und neuen technischen Hilfsmitteln zur Unterstützung der Diabetestherapie miterlebt. Die neuesten Fortschritte waren für mich bahnbrechend: Im Januar 2018 wechselte ich zu einer Pumpe und einem CGM-Sensor, der alle 5 Minuten meinen Blutzuckerspiegel überprüft. Im Februar 2018 habe ich mit meinem Android-Handy ein Regelungssystem ("The Loop") eingerichtet. Das hatte enorme Folgen, da jetzt mein Blutzuckerspiegel sehr nahe an den Werten eines Nicht-Diabetikers ohne schwere Hypoglykämien (zu wenig Zucker im Blut) und mit einem geringeren Anteil an nicht schweren Hypoglykämien lag. Dadurch ist mein Alltag sehr viel komfortabler und vor allem sicherer geworden. Jetzt kann ich meinen Blutzuckerspiegel sogar auf meiner Armbanduhr ablesen.

Obwohl der Loop einen recht gut und sicher durch die Nacht bringt, wacht man manchmal auf und fragt sich, wie sein Blutzuckerspiegel aussehen könnte. Da ich meine Armbanduhr über Nacht nicht trage, war das eine unschöne Komfortlücke in der Nacht. Ich musste also mein Handy auf dem Nachttisch suchen und dann versuchen, den Zuckerspiegel mit verschlafenen Augen abzulesen. Ich beschloss, diese Lücke zu schließen und ein Gerät zu erstellen, das die Uhrzeit, den Blutzuckerspiegel und die Entwicklungsrichtung auf dem Display in großen, leicht lesbaren Buchstaben anzeigt.

Wenn Du an Diabetes leidest und keine Ahnung hast, worüber ich oben gesprochen habe, schlage ich vor, dass Du dich über folgende Themen informierst:

- Pumpen (Wäre das eine Lösung für mich?)

- kontinuierliche Blutzuckermesssysteme wie CGM-Systeme oder FGM-Systeme (mit einigen Optimierungen)

- das Nightscout-Projekt: es bringt Ihre Daten in die Cloud und ermöglicht den geräteübergreifenden Zugriff und webbasierte Berichterstellung

Die mit diesem Projekt eingeführte Blutzuckeruhr hängt von der Verwendung des Nightscout-Projekts zur Speicherung Ihrer kontinuierlichen Blutzuckerspiegel ab, die von einem CMG- oder FGM-System stammen. Diese Werte werden durch eine zwingend vorhandene WLAN-Internetverbindung (ein stationärer WLAN-Router wird empfohlen) von der Uhr verwendet.

Verzichterklärung:

Bitte triff keine therapeutischen Entscheidungen basierend auf der Anzeige des Geräts. Wenn Du es dennoch tust, dann auf eigene Gefahr. Dies ist kein medizinisches Gerät und entspricht nicht den medizinischen Standards oder Vorschriften.

Technische Vorraussetzungen:

Es muss Nightscout mit diesem Projekt verwendet werden. Benötigt werden eine WiFi-Internetverbindung und ein Mobiltelefon mit Android (iOS (Apple) bis 4.000 € Stretchgoal), um das Gerät zu konfigurieren. Außerdem muss ein Setup bestehen, das Ihre CGM / FCM-Blutzuckerwerte in Nightscout hochlädt.

Was du bekommst:

Wir haben die Uhr ohne Knöpfe gestaltet. Die Konfiguration erfolgt über eine Android (iOS (Apple) bis 4.000 € Stretchgoal) "Steuerungs-App", die kostenlos zur Verfügung gestellt wird. Aufgrund der Willkür von Apple hinsichtlich der Akzeptanz von Apps, die auf ihren Plattformen erstellt wurden, können wir die Veröffentlichung der iOS (Apple) -Version nicht garantieren, auch wenn dies durchaus wahrscheinlich ist.

Produktmerkmale:

- Android-Bluetooth-Steuerungs-App (Apple als Stretchgoal)

- konfigurierbares Zeitfomat (12h / 24h)

- konfigurierbare Zeitzone

- die Zeit wird aus dem Internet bezogen

- die Farbe der Schrift ist über die App veränderbar

- die Helligkeit des Displays ist über die App konfigurierbar

- Die automatische Helligkeitsanpassung ist optional und kann über die App eingestellt werden

Die Blutzuckeruhr kann über das Internet aktualisiert werden. Das gilt auch für die ausgelieferten Prototypen.

Wir liefern die Uhren in der Reihenfolge der Indigogo-Backing-Nummer (prototype pledge levels haben ein früheres Lieferdatum). Die Montage ist ein manueller Vorgang.

Der Versand wird separat über den Pledgemanager abgerechnet.

Wir werden kostenlose Farboptionen (mindestens eine) und optional eine Zusatzfarbe während des Pledgemanagerprozesses anbieten. Wir haben uns noch nicht entschieden, welche Möglichkeiten es geben wird. Des Weiteren haben wir ebenso noch nicht endgültig entschieden welches Material für das Gehäuse verwendet wird. Die Entscheidung hängt auch von der Anzahl der verkauften Geräte ab. Bei weniger als 100 Geräten verwenden wir vorzugsweise unseren 3D-Drucker zur Herstellung der Gehäuse. Wir werden einen zweiten Druckers bei 50 verkauften Geräten hinzufügen. Mit 100 verkauften Geräten erwägen wir die Auslagerung der Gehäusefertigung an eine Spritzgussfabrik. Dies würde sich negativ auf den Zeitplan des Projekts auswirken, die Qualität der Gehäuse jedoch drastisch verbessern.

Hinweis: Höchstwahrscheinlich wird das Gehäuse aus einem 3D-Drucker hergestellt und wird somit nicht das Gefühl und die Qualität haben, die Du von industriell hergestellten Kunststoffen kennst. Wenn wir uns für die Verwendung von PLA als Kunststoff für den 3D-Drucker entscheiden, sollte das Gehäuse keinen Temperaturen über 70 ° C und keinem direkten Sonnenlicht ausgesetzt werden. Daher wäre dieses Gerät in Deinem Auto nicht gut aufgehoben. Wir arbeiten noch daran, den Produktions- und Vorproduktionsprozess zu optimieren.

Das Gerät wird über einen 5-V-Micro-USB-Anschluss mit Strom versorgt. Der Netzstecker und die Kabel werden nicht mit dem Gerät geliefert. Vorraussichtlich wird ein passendes Netzteil mit deutschem Anschluss und Kabel als kleine Erweiterung über den Pledgemanager zu erwerben sein. Ein normaler USB-Stecker (1 A reicht aus) und ein Micro-USB-Kabel (die meisten Telefone verwenden diesen Anschluss!) sind in den meisten Haushalten bereits vorhanden und müssen nicht extra angeschafft werden.

aktueller Stand des Projekts:

Wir haben die Hardware fertiggestellt, die wir einsetzen wollen. Dazu gehört eine Mikroprozessorplatine mit Bluetooth und WLAN und geringem Energieverbrauch. Wir haben ein 2,8 "-Farb-TFT-Display für ein modernes Display und eine fotoempfindliche LED (Fotosensor) gewählt, um eine entsprechende Helligkeitskonfiguration zu ermöglichen. Wir speichern die Konfiguration derzeit im Code. Wir können bereits Blutzuckerwerte und -entwicklungen von einer SSL-verschlüsselten Nightscout-Seite lesen und anzeigen. Wir haben das Gehäuse-Design fast fertiggestellt. Wir müssen lediglich die Passform der Mikroprozessorplatine und den Zugriff auf den USB-Stromstecker optimieren. Außerdem ist noch offen herauszufinden, welche Schrauben geeignet sind. Mit der Uhr stellen wir bisher eine Bluetooth-Beispielverbindung her und haben den Code für den Firmware-Aktualisierungsprozess vorbereitet.

Unser Team:

Wir haben ein kleines Büro in der Region Hannover. Unser Projektteam besteht aus:

Jens: leitender Softwareentwickler mit einem Dimploma in der Informatik.

Anna Lena: Junior Software Entwickler (erledigt die meiste Arbeit ;-))

Sonja: Marketing

Hannes: CAD-Design des Gehäuses

Das Unternehmen:

Das Unternehmen bearbeitet seit 2011 sehr unterschiedliche Software- und Hardware-Projekte. Wir befinden uns derzeit im Übergang und ändern die Rechtsform des Unternehmens. Das Projekt wird von der neu gegründeten "ibis-IT UG (haftungsbeschränkt)" betrieben. Höchstwahrscheinlich wird das Suffix UG zum Zeitpunkt der Lieferung durch GmbH ersetzt, die lediglich eine Rechtsform mit höherem eingelegtem Kapital darstellt. Jens ist der Geschäftsführer des Unternehmens.

Vielleicht auch interessant:

Das gesamte Setup von Jens 'Open Loop System:

- Sooil Dana-R Pumpe (neueste Version ist Dana-RS!)

- Dexcom G5 CGM System (2019 auf G6 umgestellt)

- Android-Mobiltelefon OnePlus 5T mit X-Drip zum Lesen von CGM-Werten und AndroidAPS für die Regelung der geschlossenen Schleife und der Pumpe.

- Sony Smart Watch 2 als zusätzliche Blutzuckeranzeige

- Blutzuckeruhr auf dem Nachttisch ;-)

Vielen Dank für Eure Unterstützung und vielen Dank an die Open-Source-Community, insbesondere an die beteiligten Personen, die uns so großartige Tools wie Nightscout, OpenAPS, AndroidAPS und xDrip zur Verfügung stellen !!!

Veröffentlichte Stretchgoals:

4.000 €: iOS Control App

5.000 €: Fügen wir der Produktionslinie einen zweiten 3D-Drucker hinzu

6.000 €: Unterstützung kleinerer umschaltbarer Themes und/oder Hintergründe der Uhr

Versandkosten, Steuern und Zoll

Die Versandkosten werden nach der Kampagne hinzugefügt und gesondert abgerechnet. Das Paket sollte weniger als 2 kg wiegen. Somit ergeben sich ca 6 € für Deutschland und 15 € für andere EU Länder, sowie 20 € für USA - um eine grobe Voreinschätzung zu geben.
Das Produkt wird von Deutschland aus versandt. Somit sind für EU-Bürger kein Zollverkehr notwendig und Mehrwertsteher ist bereits enthalten. Für EU-Ausland übernehmen wir die Mehrwertsteuer (bis zu 25%). Wenn diese nicht durch unsere Zollerklärung schon verrechnet wird, dann bekommst Du die bezahlte Mehrwertsteuer als Rückerstattung gegen Nachweis.

Warenzeichen:

Dana-R, Dexcom G5 / G6, OnePlus 5T, Sony Smart Watch, X-Drip und AndroidAPS sowie Nightscout sind Marken ihrer jeweiligen Eigentümer.
story_txt: Bitte ganz nach unten scrollen für die deutsche Version.  (Scroll down for the german version)Testimony from the lead developer:Hello,  my name is Jens and I am the lead developer of this project. I got  diagnosed with diabetes (mellitus) type 1 in 1994 at the age of 14.  Since then I experienced many improvements through the innovation of new  medicaments and new technical tools supporting the diabetes therapy. The  latest steps for me were ground-breaking: in January 2018 I switched to  an pump and a CGM sensor which is monitoring my blood sugar  level every 5 minutes. In February 2018 I set up a closed loop  regulating system ("the loop") using my android mobile phone. This had a  huge impact as now my blood sugar levels were now very close to a non  diabetic's levels without any severe hypoglycaemia (too few sugar in the  blood) and with a reduced level of non-severe hypoglycaemias. Also this  came with much more comfort and safety. I may even read my blood  sugar levels on my arm watch.Even though the loop brings you quite  well and safe through the night, sometimes you wake up and wonder what  your blood sugar levels might be. This was a small gap of comfort  during the night because I would not wear my arm watch and I had too  look for my phone on the night desk and then try to read the sugar level  with sleepy eyes. I decided I want to close the gap and create a device  that is showing the time, blood sugar level and development direction  on the display in huge, easy readable letters.If you have diabetes and have no idea what I was talking about above, I suggest you find out more regarding these topics:- pumps (is this right for me?)- any continuous blood glucose measurement systems like CGM systems or FGM systems (with some tweaks)- the Nightscout project - bringing your data to the cloud allowing cross device access and web based reportingThe  blood glucose clock introduced with this project is dependent on the  usage of the Nightscout project for storing your continuous blood glucose  levels coming from a CMG or FGM system. It is obtaining these values  through the usage of a mandatory WiFi internet connection (a stationary  WiFi router is recommended). Disclaimers: Please  do not make any therapeutical decisions based on the device's display.  If you do so you do it on your own risk. This is not a medical device  and not compliant with any medical standards or regulations.Technical disclaimer: You need to use Nightscout with this project. You need a WiFi  internet connection and a mobile phone with Android (iOS (Apple) through  4.000€ stretch goal)  to configure the device. You need any setup that  uploads your CGM/FCM blood glucose levels to Nightscout.What you will get:We designed the clock without any buttons. So the configuration will  be done through an android (iOS (Apple) through 4.000€ stretch goal)  "control app" that is supplied free of charge. Due to Apple's  arbitrariness regarding the acceptance of apps created on their  platforms, we cannot guarantee the release of the iOS (Apple) version  even though it is quite probable.Product Features:- Android Bluetooth control app (Apple stretch goal)- 12h/24h clock configurable- time zone configurable- time is taken from an internet source- colour changeable through app- brightness configurable through app- automatic brightness levelling is optional and configurable through the appThe blood sugar clock will be updatable via internet. This will also apply to the prototypes.We will deliver the clocks in the order of the indigogo backing  number (prototype pledge levels have an earlier delivery date). The assembly is a manual process.The shipping will be charged separately through the pledge manager process.We will offer free colour options (at least one) and optionally addon  colouring during the pledge manager process. We have not decided, yet  what the options will be. We have also not decided, yet, on the casing's  material. This will also be dependent on the number of devices we sell.  Under 100 devices we prefer to use our 3D printer to produce the  casings. We will consider buying a second one with 50 devices sold. With  100 devices sold we will consider outsourcing the case production to a  moulding lab. This would impact the project's timetable negatively but  improve the casings quality drastically.Note: Most likely the casing will be 3D printer produced and will not  have the feel and quality you are accustomed to with industrial  manufactured plastics. If we choose the use PLA as the 3D printer  plastic the casing should not be subjected to temperatures above 70°C  and not to direct sunlight. Therefore PLA would be a bad material to  have in your car. We are still working on optimizing the production and  pre-production process.The device is powered by a 5V micro USB port. The power plug and  cables are not supplied with the device. We might add these as a small  add-on through the pledge manager. A usual USB (1 A is sufficient) power  plug and micro USB cable (most phones use these!) are already found in  most households.State of the project  We have finalized the hardware that we want to employ. This  includes a microprocessor board with Bluetooth and WiFi and low energy  consumption. We chose a 2.8" colour TFT display for a modern display and a  photo sensitive LED (photo sensor) to allow a sourrounding matching  brightness configuration. We are currently storing the configuration in  the code and are able to read & display blood glucose levels and  development directions from an SSL encrypted nightscout page. We have  almost finished the casing design. Mainly we need optimize the fitting  of the microprocessor board and the access to the USB power plug. We  also need to figure out which screws may be suitable. We have set up a  sample Bluetooth connection and we have prepared code for the firmware  update process.The TeamWe have a small office in the Hanover region. Our project team consists of Jens: lead senior software developer with a diploma in computer science. Anna Lena: junior software developer (does most of the work ;-) ) Sonja: Marketing  Hannes: CAD case designThe Company The company "ibis-IT" is operating since 2011 engaging in very different software and small hardware projects. We are currently in transition changing the legal form of the company. The project is operated by the newly founded "ibis-IT UG (haftungsbeschränkt)". Most likely by the time of delivery the suffix UG will replaced with GmbH which is a legal form of the same time with higher authorized capital. Jens is the CEO of the company.Side note: The whole setup of Jens' open loop system- Sooil Dana-R pump (newest Version is Dana-RS!)- Dexcom G5 CGM System (switching to G6 in 2019)- Android mobile phone OnePlus 5T using X-Drip for reading CGM values  and AndroidAPS for the closed loop and pump control.- Sony Smart Watch 2 as an additional blood sugar display- Blood sugar clock on the night table ;-)Thank you for your support and thank you to the open source  community especially the individuals involved providing us with such  such great tools as Nightscout, OpenAPS, AndroidAPS and xDrip!!!revealed Stretch Goals:4.000 €: iOS Control App5.000 €: add second 3D-Printer to the production line6.000 €: support minor switchable themes or backgroundsShipping Costs, Taxes & Customs:All shipping costs will be added post-campaign. This is necessary to cover all individual locations. The package should be < 2kg. So Germany should be around 6 €, EU around 15 €, USA around 20 €  - to give you a rough estimate.The product is delivered from Europe. For Europeans there are no customs and the taxes are included. For outside EU we will cover the VAT (until max. 25%). If it not covered with our customs declaration you will receive the VAT as a refund when you provide a proof.Trademarks:Dana-R, Dexcom G5/G6, OnePlus 5T, Sony Smart Watch, X-Drip and AndroidAPS and Nightscout are trademarks of their respective owners.-------------------------------------------German TranslationDeutsche ÜbersetzungStatement des leitenden Entwicklers:Hallo, mein Name ist Jens und bin der leitende Entwickler dieses Projekts. Wir befinden uns derzeit im Übergang und ändern die Rechtsform des Unternehmens. Das Projekt wird von der neu gegründeten "ibis-IT UG (haftungsbeschränkt)" betrieben. Höchstwahrscheinlich wird das Suffix UG zum Zeitpunkt der Lieferung durch GmbH ersetzt, die lediglich eine Rechtsform mit höherem eingelegtem Kapital darstellt. Jens ist der Geschäftsführer des Unternehmens.Vielleicht auch interessant:Das gesamte Setup von Jens 'Open Loop System:- Sooil Dana-R Pumpe (neueste Version ist Dana-RS!)- Dexcom G5 CGM System (2019 auf G6 umgestellt)- Android-Mobiltelefon OnePlus 5T mit X-Drip zum Lesen von CGM-Werten und AndroidAPS für die Regelung der geschlossenen Schleife und der Pumpe.- Sony Smart Watch 2 als zusätzliche Blutzuckeranzeige- Blutzuckeruhr auf dem Nachttisch ;-)Vielen Dank für Eure Unterstützung und vielen Dank an die Open-Source-Community, insbesondere an die beteiligten Personen, die uns so großartige Tools wie Nightscout, OpenAPS, AndroidAPS und xDrip zur Verfügung stellen !!!Veröffentlichte Stretchgoals:4.000 €: iOS Control App5.000 €: Fügen wir der Produktionslinie einen zweiten 3D-Drucker hinzu6.000 €: Unterstützung kleinerer umschaltbarer Themes und/oder Hintergründe der UhrVersandkosten, Steuern und ZollDie Versandkosten werden nach der Kampagne hinzugefügt und gesondert abgerechnet. Das Paket sollte weniger als 2 kg wiegen. Somit ergeben sich ca 6 € für Deutschland und 15 € für andere EU Länder, sowie 20 € für USA - um eine grobe Voreinschätzung zu geben.Das Produkt wird von Deutschland aus versandt. Somit sind für EU-Bürger kein Zollverkehr notwendig und Mehrwertsteher ist bereits enthalten. Für EU-Ausland übernehmen wir die Mehrwertsteuer (bis zu 25%). Wenn diese nicht durch unsere Zollerklärung schon verrechnet wird, dann bekommst Du die bezahlte Mehrwertsteuer als Rückerstattung gegen Nachweis.Warenzeichen:Dana-R, Dexcom G5 / G6, OnePlus 5T, Sony Smart Watch, X-Drip und AndroidAPS sowie Nightscout sind Marken ihrer jeweiligen Eigentümer.

story:
Hello,

My name is Pierre LAMY.

I'm the founder of Yoonoz' Original Nose Vaporizer Brand ! I've designed the first ever Patent-Pending nose vaporizer for aromatherapy, essential oils, Eliquids and...well... all your mind can imagine!

I'm truly proud to finally be able to release to all of you what i know is something really big, unique and i dare say historical !

Indeed, It's not everyday that, not only one does discover a mostly forgotten device and  method of intake used for centuries, but also does re-engineer it to a whole new, healthier, tastier, smoother, more efficient and versatile level !

THIS is the First Nose Vaporizer Ever ! by Yoonoz.

 

 

Let me first tell you how it all started as we actually have a real cool story to tell !

Truth be told, i stumbled upon this idea while thinking about how to bypass "regular"  smoke/vapor intake through the mouth, as i am very sensitive to dryness of the mouth and its negative effects on gums and buccal health in general.

It was a daily concern to me, until one day as i was re-reading a classic book written by R.E Schultes ( the real life inspiration for "Indiana Jones" , famed biologist/ethnobotanist/historian/adventurer/professor) and called "Plants of the Gods". Inside a tiny picture caught my attention: a drawing of a nose-pipe.

I never knew that Native-American/South-American cultures had commonly used nose-pipes for hundreds, if not thousands of years, depending on historians.

A nose-pipe?!? Could that be the answer i was searching for to solve my problem?

 

 

Scouring the internet, i couldn't find much informations on the history of nose pipes and certainly could not find one company offering any modern form of it... but i still managed to find a few historical gems! Besides some rare and fascinating articles written by History Geeks, one was a quote i found from Gonzalo Fernandez de Oviedo, Governor of Hispaniola (an island near Haïti), describing how the “evil practice” of smoking by locals, was back in 1525:

“Their chiefs employ a pipe filled with the lighted weed, inserting the forked extremities into their nostrils. . . . In this way they imbibe the smoke until they become unconscious and lie sprawling on the ground like men in a drunken slumber.”

The original design of these nose-pipes looked obviously highly unpractical to use, made in clay and most of all were using combustion to produce the smoke, resulting in what probably was a highly unpleasant experience for the nose...not good...but it seemed to be pretty efficient in its effects and one thing was for certain:  Indigenous tribes were not using this method for fun or by mistakes: it clearly was a route that was deemed worthwile even though it clearly had rough drawbacks  as it was and  mouth-pipes were available to use...

 

 

That's when it all clicked and i got the idea for our original design!  A "tuning key" pyrex glass nose-pipe, provided it had the proper "cool off" length, tube diametre and nostrils spacing, would not only be easy to use but it would eliminate combustion and allow for fully controlable vaporization just by heating below the glass bowl !

It seemed so logical! Absolutely no one was offering anything like it! Until now!

I went ahead and was lucky enough to find out that one of the few manufacturers in France specialized in medical and high-end perfumery glassware, was located a few miles away from where i was!

Once a basic prototype was designed, i soon realized that not only did it work as i had hoped it did, but it had major unexpected positive benefits that were clearly opening up a whole new world of possibilities, not only for Eliquids, but for essential oils too and so much more!

After many weeks and tweaks and revisions to attain the perfect product, we commissioned our manufacturer a small batch of the final , now patent-pending, design for us.

The original nose vaporizer that we offer exclusively on Indiegogo is the result of all this hard work!  We are already working outside of France for much larger production capacity so this batch is and will always remain special! But much bigger things are yet to come!

Why our Nose Vaporizer is Great (and it just makes sens) :

As far as efficacy is concerned, the nasal mucous being an outstanding absorption tool, then combined with "regular" absorption through the lungs, seems to be the reason for the punch-packing potency and efficiency described earlier.

In fact, science says that your nose is the best tool for detecting tastes. So basically, no nose = no taste ! Your mouth and tongue can only detect very general categories like salty, sweet, bitter etc..but all the "fine tunings" come from the combination with nose!

Ever had a bad cold that left you unable to taste the foods you were trying to eat? Yep...Ever tried to swallow a bad tasting medicine as a kid? didn't you pinch your nose? Yep...

Our design eliminates the harshness of combustion and allows you for the first time to vaporize a quasi infinite number of essentials oils, Eliquids, medicinal plants and mixes inhaled straight to your nose for the best results possible !

At Yoonoz we really feel that our mission is to offer people a better, healthier, more modern, versatile and useful version of a long forgotten classic  that has been a part of Mankind's heritage since almost the dawn of time.

We truly believe that our nose vaporizer can be a massive success and we need to get enough funding for large scale production and marketing so that when imitators show up (and they will!),  we are already well established, and as we should, as the Original Nose-Vaporizer Brand.

We need to hit big and fast and we need you to back us up!

We want to thank Indiegogo and all of you early birds for the support! We are glad to have you pioneer alongside us this new world of possibilities !

story:
Sparrow Health & Performance purpose is to restore hope through whole body treatment. We want to encourage people to be victorious in fulfilling their calling and purpose. It is our goal to help people see where they currently are, where they would like to be, and what is needed to get there. Our approach is proactive, not reactive. Sparrow strives to assist individuals and their families in achieving balance by assisting the body in its natural design to heal itself.

All contributions will be going to opening our own stand-alone clinic apart from our partner clinics so we can reach and aid more people on their journey to hope and healing. This stand-alone clinic will allow us to further push the research, continuously change the standard of health, and develop a new class of athletes and performers.

See more: www.sparrowclinic.com

 

About Our Services:

 

 

 

BioScans

What is a BioScan?

We work with one of the most advanced and effective bio-resonance balancing and remedy selection systems in energetic medicine. This revolutionary, fully automatic software-based analysis, tests for over 285,000 different imbalances, disorders (physical and psychological), destructive substances (poisons, toxins, bacteria, fungi, viruses, parasites, allergens) and deficiencies in a totally objective way.

This non-invasive test detects weaknesses in the body, including those that are genetically innate via hair sample.

The test not only scans the entire body for imbalances but also gives a comprehensive balancing session tailored to the client. All the necessary remedies for the client are produced in a complex Bio-resonance form at a precise potency in one bottle along with an imbalance report.

Bio-resonance therapy aims to restore healthy patterns and balance to the body, resulting in an improved sense of mental clarity, vitality, and optimum wellness.

The test offers dramatic results with the latest cutting-edge technology that is having a major impact on holistic therapies and treatments worldwide. Backed by over 40 years of research, it is safe and can be used to aid numerous chronic or underlying physical, mental, and emotional issues in humans and animals of all ages.

Who Can Benefit from BioScans?

BioScanning can benefit anyone. Because we live in an imperfect world, our body is always striving for balance. BioScanning allows your body to find its equilibrium that the world has taken away.

Functional Tests:

Allergen Sensitivities

Chemical Toxicity

Circulatory Disturbances 

Digestive Maladies

Female Issues

Immune Disorders

Inherited Predispositions 

Joint Ailments

Male Issues

Metabolic Disturbances

Neurotransmitter Imbalances 

Nutritional Deficiencies

Pathogenic Factors

Phenolic Sensitivities 

Respiratory Issues 

Skin Afflictions

Sleep Disturbances

Urinary Disorders 

& more

How Long Will It Take to See Results from BioScans?

BioFeedback results vary on a case to case basis. Some people see immediate results, some people take a little bit longer.

 

Brain Mapping

What is Brain Mapping?

A brain map is similar to a weather map showing high & low temperatures. The brain map (also called a neuro-map) is an important tool we use to evaluate your brainwaves and identify opportunities to improve communication between various regions of the brain.

The brain sends messages with neurons, in the form of electrical impulses, creating brain waves. A brain map is able to capture a window of brain activity, analyze the data, and create a visual representation of each lobe of the brain and each specific brain wave (Delta, Theta, Alpha, Beta). 

Who Can Benefit from Brain Mapping?

Everyone can benefit from brain mapping. Whether you are a professional athlete to your next door neighbor, there are countless ways to benefit from brain mapping. Brain mapping has been proven to even help with the following symptoms:

ADD/ADHD, Anxiety, Autism, Bipolar Disorder, Brain Injury, Chronic Pain, Depression, Dyslexia, Epilepsy/Seizures, Fibromyalgia, Learning Disorders, Migraines, OCD/Tourette's, PTSD, Schizophrenia, Sleep Disorders, Stroke, Substance Abuse. 

How Long Does It Take to See Results from Brain Mapping?

You will not be able to see changes with the initial brain mapping. You see the results after going through neurofeedback training. For more information, check out our page on neurofeedback.

Cryobanking

What is Cryobanking?

A cryobank is a medical facility that stores a wide variety of tissues and cells in a state of deep freeze. Some cryobanks store human samples such as stem cells that are later used for research or treatment of various types of cancers.

These facilities typically have a cryopreservation unit, which is used for the actual storage of the materials. Many use liquid nitrogen to preserve the tissues or cells, which lowers the temperature below freezing and keeps the cells viable for research or other applications.

Materials are carefully prepared before they are put through the freezing process, in which water molecules within the samples are frozen. There is typically a loss of some tissues, but the majority of the sample remains intact for as long as it is frozen. Since the purity of each sample is of vital importance, most cryobanks do not put the liquid nitrogen in direct contact with the sample in order to freeze it. Instead, samples are put in freezers and kept separate from the liquid nitrogen, frozen by the temperature of the environment instead.

Neurofeedback

What is Neurofeedback?

Neurofeedback is an exercise for the brain! Neurofeedback, also called qEEG Biofeedback is a state-of-the-art, non-invasive method for teaching the brain to function in a more balanced and healthful way. It does so by shifting the way the brain produces and distributes its electrical energy. Four divisions of electrical impulses made by our brain, Delta, Theta, Alpha, and Beta are called “Frequency Bands”. These Frequency Bands tell us which parts of your brain are active and which frequency bands the brain should be using to complete a given task or activity. For instance, when we are balancing our checkbooks or in a class following directions, certain areas of our brain will need to be active and using the faster frequency called Beta. On the other hand, if after a long day we wish to relax and wind down, a different part of the brain will need to be activated using the slower brain wave frequency called Alpha. The goal of Neurofeedback is to improve the brain’s ability to self-regulate, maintain flexibility, and smoothly shift between states of relaxation and arousal. Since the Brain also controls Attention Regulation, Emotional Regulation and Affect Regulation, this ultimately allows the entire Central Nervous System to resume normal functioning.

How is Neurofeedback Done?

Sensors are placed on the head and ears to record the brain wave activity. High-tech equipment amplifies the electrical impulses and breaks them into the four key frequency bands. Using sophisticated computer software a customized protocol is developed to address the individual’s unique needs. During the session, the Neurofeedback Clinician views the raw qEEG signal as well as the chosen frequency bands. Exercises are typically performed with eyes open. With eyes open, the Client is watching a video or playing a game. The video fades in and out depending on whether or not the brain is increasing the desired frequencies and decreasing other frequencies. At the conclusion of the 30 Minute training period, the Clinician shares and discusses the Training Review Screen.

Why Does Neurofeedback Work?

Neurofeedback takes advantage of the brain’s ability to change itself through a process known as Neuroplasticity. It utilizes the same learning process that occurs whenever we acquire a new skill. The brain learns by forming connections between nerve cells and utilizing important pathways that connect different locations in the brain. The more frequently you utilize these pathways the better the brain becomes at performing the associated task. In psychology, this type of learning is called “Operant Conditioning”. It is a type of learning in which responses come to be controlled by their consequences. Quite simply, Neurofeedback offers the perfect learning conditions, since it facilitates awareness of when the brain is producing healthier brainwave patterns, provides reinforcement for the positive change and multiple opportunities to provide practice during a training session.

Who Can Benefit from Neurofeedback?

Everyone can benefit from brain mapping. From the professional athlete to your next door neighbor, there are countless ways to benefit from brain mapping. Brain mapping has been proven to even help with the following symptoms:

ADD/ADHD, Anxiety, Autism, Bipolar Disorder, Brain Injury, Chronic Pain, Depression, Dyslexia, Epilepsy/Seizures, Fibromyalgia, Learning Disorders, Migraines, OCD/Tourette's, PTSD, Schizophrenia, Sleep Disorders, Stroke, Substance Abuse.

Neurofeedback results vary on a case to case basis. Some people see immediate results, some people take a little bit longer.

Stem Cell Therapy

What is Stem Cell Therapy?

Stem cells are unspecialized cells that can replicate and differentiate (change to specialized cells or body parts). Amazingly, your body fat is loaded with millions of stem cells. Not only can they be used to enhance cosmetic surgery procedures, they can also be harvested for a wide variety of therapeutic uses. 

Who Can Benefit from Stem Cell Therapy?

Anyone could benefit from stem cell therapy. Stem cells are unspecialized cells that can differentiate (turn into other specific cells or tissue), and replicate (multiply). Stem cell therapy can influence anything from joint issues to rejuvenating skin. 

Sparrow offers specialized protocols promoting regeneration of the body through the extraction and expansion of stem cells under IRB guidance. This is just one of the many components that set our clinic apart. Just a few of the conditions that have been treated are arthritis, asthma, autoimmune, cardiomyopathy, CIDP, CODP, Crohn’s disease, degenerative spine and disk disease, Lichen Sclerosis, Lupus, Multiple Sclerosis, Muscular Dystrophy, Myasthenia Gravis, Neuropathy, Ophthalmology conditions, orthopedics, Parkinson’s disease, Peyronies disease, relapsing polychondritis, Scleroderma, stroke recovery and urological conditions.

How is Stem Cell Therapy Done?

We are now in a new era of medicine. Our bodies are made up of dozens of trillions of cells. Up until now, medicine was predominantly aimed at keeping our cells healthy and alive through diet, exercise, medications to eradicate disease, or supplements to help our cells stay healthy, but now, going forward, we have the opportunity to replace injured or dying cells with our own DNA coded stem cells. These cells can not cause an allergic response or be rejected. While many people consider this experimental, we really consider it investigational but not really experimental. This may be a NEW era in medicine, but it really reflects perhaps the OLDEST form of intervention. Before we had any kind of medical intervention we had to rely on our body’s natural cell defense to keep us healthy. We now have the ability to unlock and harvest huge quantities of these repair cells for immediate use and, further, we can send samples to our lab where they can be cryopreserved and expanded as millions of stem cells for later use. Indeed, we have coined the term CRT – Cell Renewal Therapy – to describe how we foresee the future of medicine whereby your natural “spare parts” in the form of your own DNA cultivated stem cells will be made available to keep your body healthy and extend longevity for years beyond anything ever imaginable.

Stem cells are basically unspecialized cells that can replicate and differentiate (i.e. turn into other specialized cells). They tend to have three basic properties: 1) anti-inflammatory; 2) immune-modulatory and 3) reparative or regenerative. Most people think an embryo is the most common source for stem cells. While most stem cell studies started by using embryos, there are a number of issues and problems associated with their use. Not only are there ethical concerns, embryonic stem cells can sometimes form tumors (i.e. teratomas).

There are also a lot of stem cells naturally found in our body. Most people are aware of bone marrow derived stem cells. In recent years, bone marrow has been a source for stem cells particularly for orthopedic conditions. However, stem cell yields in bone marrow tend to be between 50,000 and 200,000 with some of the newer technology. Adipose (fat) tissue also houses vast quantities of stem cells. In fact, just 30 cc’s (2 tablespoons) of fat can yield between 10 and 30 million stem cells.

Our fat derived stem cells have a tremendous capacity to turn into a large variety of tissues. Originally, because of their “mesenchymal” origin, we thought they could only turn into fat, cartilage, bone, muscle, connective tissue, blood vessels and nerve tissue, but now we have studies showing they’ve turned into practically every kind of cell in the body. While the “bone marrow” proponents will sing the virtues of bone marrow stem cells for cartilage repair, it turns out that fat derived cells are an even greater source for cartilage repair and production. Compared to a bone marrow harvest, it’s so simple to harvest a little fat and the yields are generally very high making fat an ideal source for stem cells.

Initial studies made SAFETY the primary objective and the clinical outcomes a secondary objective. Our safety study of over 1,500 patients has shown that there are no significant adverse events related to the deployment of SVF. Indeed, the only real issues have been some mild discomfort around the liposuction site – something we naturally expect.

While there are a growing number of doctors claiming to provide stem cell treatments, we believe the most ethical approach is to do it under the umbrella of IRB approved research protocols. An IRB is an Institutional Review Board or an organization of members responsible for approving and overseeing research on humans. IRBs are approved under the auspices of the U.S. Department of Human Research Protection. As such, our patients understand the investigational nature of our activities, are provided appropriate informed consents and are followed continuously on an online database to chart their progress or any issues of concern. This will allow us to not only accumulate safety data but demonstrate the effectiveness of treatments and help us to improve treatment programs going forward.

We already have a number of very innovative treatments in progress. For example, one of our approved studies involves deployment of cells via an Ommaya reservoir. This is a device that connects a port under the scalp via a tube directly into the ventricle of the brain where cells can be added to the cerebral spinal fluid. This concept evolved by working with renown Brain Surgeon, Christopher Duma, MD, FACS. It was preceded by safety studies on laboratory rats and 30 patients later are showing some significant progress.

As you can imagine, with “new” technologies, patients often come to you when they’ve exhausted most other traditional treatments. We’ve now had a lot of experience to understand how well cell therapy can work even though we’re continuing to gather data and look for ways of optimizing treatments. So, for example, most patients with arthritic knees will consider stem cell deployment after they’ve tried pain medication, steroids, hyaluronan injections and even arthroscopy. None of these are actually treatments that repair the problem but rather mask the pain or temporize the situation. If there’s cartilage in the knee then it can potentially signal your stem cells to repair the joint. We now understand that acute injuries probably respond better than chronic ones because there are more messages (cytokines) directing and instructing the stem cells into action and repair. Still, until we have enough data and publish enough articles to support these positions our concepts remain “conjecture” waiting to be proven.

Patients are also concerned about whether these procedures are FDA approved. Technically, the FDA only approves drugs and devices. We’re actually performing a surgical procedure and the FDA does not approve surgery. However, we are working with the FDA to have our system evaluated for potential FDA approval. Our initial FDA studies will be aimed at knee arthritis with the goal to show autologous SVF is more effective than a placebo. This will be done with a “double blind controlled study.” I doubt we will do FDA studies for every potential condition rather, doctors will ultimately gather data and/or do their own research and accumulate results to support the positive use of SVF for a large host of inflammatory and degenerative conditions.

 

How Long Will It Take to See Results from Stem Cell Therapy?

There are many variables that contribute to your results;  your overall health, any underlying conditions, nutrition and state of mind. You will see results based on you and your body. It varies case to case. If you would like to discuss stem cell therapy options, please contact us for a consultation.

A brain map is able to capture a window of brain activity, analyze the data, and create a visual representation of each lobe of the brain and each specific brain wave (Delta, Theta, Alpha, Beta). Who Can Benefit from Brain Mapping?Everyone can benefit from brain mapping. Whether you are a professional athlete to your next door neighbor, there are countless ways to benefit from brain mapping. Brain mapping has been proven to even help with the following symptoms:ADD/ADHD, Anxiety, Autism, Bipolar Disorder, Brain Injury, Chronic Pain, Depression, Dyslexia, Epilepsy/Seizures, Fibromyalgia, Learning Disorders, Migraines, OCD/Tourette's, PTSD, Schizophrenia, Sleep Disorders, Stroke, Substance Abuse. How Long Does It Take to See Results from Brain Mapping?You will not be able to see changes with the initial brain mapping. You see the results after going through neurofeedback training. For more information, check out our page on neurofeedback.CryobankingWhat is Cryobanking?A cryobank is a medical facility that stores a wide variety of tissues and cells in a state of deep freeze. Some cryobanks store human samples such as stem cells that are later used for research or treatment of various types of cancers.These facilities typically have a cryopreservation unit, which is used for the actual storage of the materials. Many use liquid nitrogen to preserve the tissues or cells, which lowers the temperature below freezing and keeps the cells viable for research or other applications.Materials are carefully prepared before they are put through the freezing process, in which water molecules within the samples are frozen. There is typically a loss of some tissues, but the majority of the sample remains intact for as long as it is frozen. Since the purity of each sample is of vital importance, most cryobanks do not put the liquid nitrogen in direct contact with the sample in order to freeze it. Instead, samples are put in freezers and kept separate from the liquid nitrogen, frozen by the temperature of the environment instead.NeurofeedbackWhat is Neurofeedback?Neurofeedback is an exercise for the brain! Neurofeedback, also called qEEG Biofeedback is a state-of-the-art, non-invasive method for teaching the brain to function in a more balanced and healthful way. It does so by shifting the way the brain produces and distributes its electrical energy. Four divisions of electrical impulses made by our brain, Delta, Theta, Alpha, and Beta are called “Frequency Bands”. These Frequency Bands tell us which parts of your brain are active and which frequency bands the brain should be using to complete a given task or activity. For instance, when we are balancing our checkbooks or in a class following directions, certain areas of our brain will need to be active and using the faster frequency called Beta. On the other hand, if after a long day we wish to relax and wind down, a different part of the brain will need to be activated using the slower brain wave frequency called Alpha. The goal of Neurofeedback is to improve the brain’s ability to self-regulate, maintain flexibility, and smoothly shift between states of relaxation and arousal. Since the Brain also controls Attention Regulation, Emotional Regulation and Affect Regulation, this ultimately allows the entire Central Nervous System to resume normal functioning.How is Neurofeedback Done?Sensors are placed on the head and ears to record the brain wave activity. High-tech equipment amplifies the electrical impulses and breaks them into the four key frequency bands. Using sophisticated computer software a customized protocol is developed to address the individual’s unique needs. During the session, the Neurofeedback Clinician views the raw qEEG signal as well as the chosen frequency bands. Exercises are typically performed with eyes open. With eyes open, the Client is watching a video or playing a game. The video fades in and out depending on whether or not the brain is increasing the desired frequencies and decreasing other frequencies. At the conclusion of the 30 Minute training period, the Clinician shares and discusses the Training Review Screen.Why Does Neurofeedback Work?Neurofeedback takes advantage of the brain’s ability to change itself through a process known as Neuroplasticity. It utilizes the same learning process that occurs whenever we acquire a new skill. The brain learns by forming connections between nerve cells and utilizing important pathways that connect different locations in the brain. The more frequently you utilize these pathways the better the brain becomes at performing the associated task. In psychology, this type of learning is called “Operant Conditioning”. It is a type of learning in which responses come to be controlled by their consequences. Quite simply, Neurofeedback offers the perfect learning conditions, since it facilitates awareness of when the brain is producing healthier brainwave patterns, provides reinforcement for the positive change and multiple opportunities to provide practice during a training session.Who Can Benefit from Neurofeedback?Everyone can benefit from brain mapping. From the professional athlete to your next door neighbor, there are countless ways to benefit from brain mapping. Brain mapping has been proven to even help with the following symptoms:ADD/ADHD, Anxiety, Autism, Bipolar Disorder, Brain Injury, Chronic Pain, Depression, Dyslexia, Epilepsy/Seizures, Fibromyalgia, Learning Disorders, Migraines, OCD/Tourette's, PTSD, Schizophrenia, Sleep Disorders, Stroke, Substance Abuse.Neurofeedback results vary on a case to case basis. Some people see immediate results, some people take a little bit longer.Stem Cell TherapyWhat is Stem Cell Therapy?Stem cells are unspecialized cells that can replicate and differentiate (change to specialized cells or body parts). Amazingly, your body fat is loaded with millions of stem cells. Not only can they be used to enhance cosmetic surgery procedures, they can also be harvested for a wide variety of therapeutic uses. Who Can Benefit from Stem Cell Therapy?Anyone could benefit from stem cell therapy. Stem cells are unspecialized cells that can differentiate (turn into other specific cells or tissue), and replicate (multiply). Stem cell therapy can influence anything from joint issues to rejuvenating skin. Sparrow offers specialized protocols promoting regeneration of the body through the extraction and expansion of stem cells under IRB guidance. This is just one of the many components that set our clinic apart. Just a few of the conditions that have been treated are arthritis, asthma, autoimmune, cardiomyopathy, CIDP, CODP, Crohn’s disease, degenerative spine and disk disease, Lichen Sclerosis, Lupus, Multiple Sclerosis, Muscular Dystrophy, Myasthenia Gravis, Neuropathy, Ophthalmology conditions, orthopedics, Parkinson’s disease, Peyronies disease, relapsing polychondritis, Scleroderma, stroke recovery and urological conditions.How is Stem Cell Therapy Done?We are now in a new era of medicine. Our bodies are made up of dozens of trillions of cells. Up until now, medicine was predominantly aimed at keeping our cells healthy and alive through diet, exercise, medications to eradicate disease, or supplements to help our cells stay healthy, but now, going forward, we have the opportunity to replace injured or dying cells with our own DNA coded stem cells. These cells can not cause an allergic response or be rejected. While many people consider this experimental, we really consider it investigational but not really experimental. This may be a NEW era in medicine, but it really reflects perhaps the OLDEST form of intervention. Before we had any kind of medical intervention we had to rely on our body’s natural cell defense to keep us healthy. We now have the ability to unlock and harvest huge quantities of these repair cells for immediate use and, further, we can send samples to our lab where they can be cryopreserved and expanded as millions of stem cells for later use. Indeed, we have coined the term CRT – Cell Renewal Therapy – to describe how we foresee the future of medicine whereby your natural “spare parts” in the form of your own DNA cultivated stem cells will be made available to keep your body healthy and extend longevity for years beyond anything ever imaginable.Stem cells are basically unspecialized cells that can replicate and differentiate (i.e. turn into other specialized cells). They tend to have three basic properties: 1) anti-inflammatory; 2) immune-modulatory and 3) reparative or regenerative. Most people think an embryo is the most common source for stem cells. While most stem cell studies started by using embryos, there are a number of issues and problems associated with their use. Not only are there ethical concerns, embryonic stem cells can sometimes form tumors (i.e. teratomas).There are also a lot of stem cells naturally found in our body. Most people are aware of bone marrow derived stem cells. In recent years, bone marrow has been a source for stem cells particularly for orthopedic conditions. However, stem cell yields in bone marrow tend to be between 50,000 and 200,000 with some of the newer technology. Adipose (fat) tissue also houses vast quantities of stem cells. In fact, just 30 cc’s (2 tablespoons) of fat can yield between 10 and 30 million stem cells.Our fat derived stem cells have a tremendous capacity to turn into a large variety of tissues. Originally, because of their “mesenchymal” origin, we thought they could only turn into fat, cartilage, bone, muscle, connective tissue, blood vessels and nerve tissue, but now we have studies showing they’ve turned into practically every kind of cell in the body. While the “bone marrow” proponents will sing the virtues of bone marrow stem cells for cartilage repair, it turns out that fat derived cells are an even greater source for cartilage repair and production. Compared to a bone marrow harvest, it’s so simple to harvest a little fat and the yields are generally very high making fat an ideal source for stem cells.Initial studies made SAFETY the primary objective and the clinical outcomes a secondary objective. Our safety study of over 1,500 patients has shown that there are no significant adverse events related to the deployment of SVF. Indeed, the only real issues have been some mild discomfort around the liposuction site – something we naturally expect.While there are a growing number of doctors claiming to provide stem cell treatments, we believe the most ethical approach is to do it under the umbrella of IRB approved research protocols. An IRB is an Institutional Review Board or an organization of members responsible for approving and overseeing research on humans. IRBs are approved under the auspices of the U.S. Department of Human Research Protection. As such, our patients understand the investigational nature of our activities, are provided appropriate informed consents and are followed continuously on an online database to chart their progress or any issues of concern. This will allow us to not only accumulate safety data but demonstrate the effectiveness of treatments and help us to improve treatment programs going forward.We already have a number of very innovative treatments in progress. For example, one of our approved studies involves deployment of cells via an Ommaya reservoir. This is a device that connects a port under the scalp via a tube directly into the ventricle of the brain where cells can be added to the cerebral spinal fluid. This concept evolved by working with renown Brain Surgeon, Christopher Duma, MD, FACS. It was preceded by safety studies on laboratory rats and 30 patients later are showing some significant progress.As you can imagine, with “new” technologies, patients often come to you when they’ve exhausted most other traditional treatments. We’ve now had a lot of experience to understand how well cell therapy can work even though we’re continuing to gather data and look for ways of optimizing treatments. So, for example, most patients with arthritic knees will consider stem cell deployment after they’ve tried pain medication, steroids, hyaluronan injections and even arthroscopy. None of these are actually treatments that repair the problem but rather mask the pain or temporize the situation. If there’s cartilage in the knee then it can potentially signal your stem cells to repair the joint. We now understand that acute injuries probably respond better than chronic ones because there are more messages (cytokines) directing and instructing the stem cells into action and repair. Still, until we have enough data and publish enough articles to support these positions our concepts remain “conjecture” waiting to be proven.Patients are also concerned about whether these procedures are FDA approved. Technically, the FDA only approves drugs and devices. We’re actually performing a surgical procedure and the FDA does not approve surgery. However, we are working with the FDA to have our system evaluated for potential FDA approval. Our initial FDA studies will be aimed at knee arthritis with the goal to show autologous SVF is more effective than a placebo. This will be done with a “double blind controlled study.” I doubt we will do FDA studies for every potential condition rather, doctors will ultimately gather data and/or do their own research and accumulate results to support the positive use of SVF for a large host of inflammatory and degenerative conditions. How Long Will It Take to See Results from Stem Cell Therapy?There are many variables that contribute to your results;  your overall health, any underlying conditions, nutrition and state of mind. You will see results based on you and your body. It varies case to case. If you would like to discuss stem cell therapy options, please contact us for a consultation.

story:
Empiric Logic is a startup company based in NovaUCD, University College Dublin, Ireland.

https://empiriclogic.com/

We're building  a secure diagnostic and analytics platform called GenoRate to help transform the treatment of cancers and rare diseases. Rare diseases are a growing public health priority and currently affect upwards of 300 million people globally, they are difficult to diagnose and treat. Additionally there are increasing numbers of hospital admissions for cancer diagnosis and treatment with an estimated 18m to 20m new cases diagnosed per year, this is expected to continue to increase annually.

Leveraging genetic data to help understand the causes of rare conditions and cancers is a very powerful tool to help quickly identify, prescribe or develop appropriate therapies. However diagnosing rare diseases and cancers and identifying the genes that cause these conditions can be extremely challenging. Researchers and clinicians often don’t have the necessary depth of expertise or time needed to work through all of the stages required to get to these answers. So they need all of the help they can get to expedite this process. 

Our aim is to provide a fast secure privacy preserving AI driven tool to improve data analysis outcomes and faster diagnosis for cancer and rare conditions.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're seeking to raise funds to build out our team and accelerate our platform development so that we can go to market sooner.
  • We've already begun but need further funding to complete our development and create a ground breaking diagnostic aid for clinicians to help them quickly identify the causes of rare conditions and cancers.
  • We aim to give contributors early access to our Identity By Descent ancestry analysis tool which will give users insights into their heritage and genealogy, an important aspect of understanding population health.
  • Even if we don't reach our funding goal any contributions will be used to further develop our platform.

The Impact

The difference your contribution will make:

  • We're laser focused on building a leading edge tool for researchers and clinicians to help get them the answers they need about diseases more quickly.
  • Some rare conditions often require acute care and need answers fast to help support decisions on the appropriate direction that care needs to go.
  • Advances in artificial intelligence technology is helping get more answers from data.
  • Using technology in this way is leading to faster more targeted treatments and therapies, helping to save lives.

Risks & Challenges

What are the challenges?

  • Finding the right skills, finding the right customers, getting access to the right data. All of these are integral to our success. 
  • We're a dedicated and expert team with many years experience in the areas of genetics, software development and business development.
  • We have access to the right data and partners to help us deliver.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute ask others to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

story:
What is UniBand?

UniBand is a wristband that clearly communicates the wearer's body temperature to those around them. 

Why is UniBand necessary?

Current infrared temperature sensors used by businesses are notoriously unreliable and inaccurate (see this New York Times article). Customers walk in and out of stores from all entrances - how confident are you that they’ve been screened? UniBand solves these problems by accurately delivering body temperature readings using a lighting scheme.

Green: Safe Zone -> Temperature under 99.5°F

Yellow: Advisory Zone -> Temperature between 99.5°F to 100.4°F

Red: Symptomatic Zone -> Temperature above 100.4°F

In our studies, we found that onlookers understood UniBand’s purpose immediately, and made them feel safer as it increased awareness of other's body temperature. The UniBand retails at an affordable price--cheaper than a pack of masks--and becomes even more beneficial as more people wear it.

Who are we? 

We're a group of Stanford engineering and biomedicine graduates who are searching for ways to make frequent in-person interactions safer.

Limitations:

UniBand is created to measure body temperature--it does NOT diagnose COVID-19 or any other medical conditions. If you are experiencing symptoms or suspect that you have COVID-19, you should consult a medical professional immediately.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everybody. My name is Adrian and this is my first personal project I am trying to develop on my own, a project I have thought about for the last 2 years.

The idea is to create a website and matching app (ios and android), as simple as possible that will allow you to easily save all your medical history. Save your lab result, medical prescriptions or any other medical data by taking a picture of them or scanning it and uploading it to the website by Mac, PC or by the app. The date and time will be automaticaly added and you will only need to create tags as to be able to easily find it in the future. 

You will no longer need to keep lots and lots of hard-copy files thinking about the possibility that you might need it sometimes in the future. It's all there, secure and accurate. 

As a parent, you will be able to create a sub-profile for your kids where to store all their medical history, by only taking photos or scanning the files.

You need to show a doctor some old results? It's as simple as downloading a file, because that's just what you'll do. You need to show him/her the result from two years ago? It's simple, search for "2013" and "lab results" from your phone and the files will be there for download as pictures. That simple.

 No one know better then you how your mind works and what mental links you use to remember something, so you will be the one to set the rules for finding medical files.

Medical files are not something we like to use or think about every day, but when the day comes when we need them, most of us not beeing as rigurous as we should be, we might not find what we are looking for, so why not make it simple? Very, very simple.

Most medical apps and website are very complicated and not user friendly. Our website will have a "facebook" like interface showing the history as you enter it and making it super easy for your to search it. 

One of the most important parts is data security and that's why the acces will be granted by a two step verification process.

What We Need & What You Get

All the money will go towards the programing of this website and app and the rest of the expenses necesarry to make it happen.

The Impact

This website will be FREE forever for everyone who will use it and will be a very usefull tool, making you realise it's importance when you need it the most, for you or your loved ones.

The website will be financed in the future by a smal number of ads.

Risks & Challenges

There is no great risk. By being free and easy to use it will catch up quickly and more and more people will use it. A challenge will be to make it as sure as medical data need to be as to prevent any leak/theft of that data.

Other Ways You Can Help

You like the idea and you think you can add value to it or help developp the project? Send me your ideas and maybe you'll be a part of this little dream.
